title: How to connect a phone to a PC wirelessly - Quora

response.answer_text: What iam going to tell works only in windows PC which has WiFi connection facility.. [math]Requirements[/math] Es file explorer android app available in play store [math]Procedure [/math] First of all turn on the hotspot in your mobile and connect to your hotspot in PC After that right click on the file,folder or drive and click on *properties*Properties menu pops up click on the *sharing* optionThen click on the *advanced sharing* buttonCheck the *enable* checkboxIf u want to edit like delete,rename,etc.. From your mobile then give all permissions option present below of *enable* checkbox(step4).Open the ES file explorer app click on menu button in left top corner . 7.now click on network-->LAN there your PC will be shown and click on your PC (identified through IP address)  You have to enter username and password of your PC then you can access anything of your PC in your mobile You can even play vedios ,display pictures,listen to songs,copy paste files etc..present in PC from your mobile . This doesn't require any software or adapter .

I occasionally plug my phone into my computer via USB for file transfer. I occasionally connect my phone to my computer wirelessly for file transfer. Sounds like your question is asking how, so here it is: My computer is on my local LAN. My phone is also capable of connecting to my local LAN via wifi. The first step is to turn wifi ON on my phone. Once connected, it is on the same LAN as my computer. On my computer, I host an FTP server. Since my computer is on a local LAN connected to the internet through a gateway router, the FTP server is not accessible from the internet … it is only accessible from the local LAN. Once my phone connects via wifi, I run a smartphone FTP client app. The first time I run it, I put in the IP of my desktop, and the username & password configured in the desktop FTP server. I only need do this once, and thereafter my FTP app will remember them to connect again. I can now transfer files from my computer to / from my phone wirelessly without needing to connect via USB, or even being by the computer (or even in the same room).
